name: Premier Inn Bristol City Centre King Street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ideally situated if you want a location close to shopping, nightlife and good restaurants this hotel offers very reasonably priced accommodation in a clean no nonsense but no frills manner. And the pub attached can be a fun and quirky way to end the evening. Want a reasonably priced, convenient, well priced venue then this is definitely worth considering.
reviews.title: Great for a weekend break

reviews.text: I decided to walk in the rain to the hotel
reviews.title: Wonderful city

reviews.text: I got to the hotel early but was allowed to book in early then 2pm
reviews.title: Better than the Haymarket

reviews.text: That was appriciated
reviews.title: Comfortable but noisy

reviews.text: Had a meal in the resturant
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights and would have stayed longer but they were full. Rigt next to Welsh Back and lots of nice restaurants, bars and with a pub next door...very centrally located to shopping centers, banks, harbourside etc. Check in was smooth, my room was facing other buildings so it was totally peaceful. They have a tray with tea, coffee, milk etc in reception so you can take as much as you need if you use up what you have in the room. Vending machine in reception for drinks, chocolate, toothbrush etc. though it was our of order when I was there. I stupidly arrived without a us/uk adapter and reception very kindly provided me with one. Loved the extra large bath towel in room. The room was a very nice size, comfortable mattress and choice of soft and firm pillows. The tv screen was a bit like a computer monitor but I didn't watch tv so it didn't matter to me. It is a budget hotel but had everything you need except a lobby area to sit in but who needs to pay $100 more for that. I did not try the restaurant adjacent to the building but the menu looked well priced and had a wide range of food. I also liked the door knob flyer where you can choose to not have your room cleaned if you wish...this is useful for times when you need to work in your room and don't feel obliged to leave so housekeeping can clean..I liked this option and have not seen it before...unless you use the do not disturb option which is really not the same.
reviews.title: Excellent location and stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stopped here for two nights over a weekend. The check in was smooth and easy, and having asked for a quiet room the day before we were placed away from the road. The room was really large and the bed was very comfy. The only issue we had was that it was very hot through the night, and opening the window didn't do much to help.
reviews.title: Great location
Very central (and what it says on the tin....)
reviews.text: Couldn't comment on breakfast as we opted to eat at the wetherspoons on the harbourside.
The location itself is great, and there is a really good atmosphere at the harbourside bars which we enjoyed. We walked right round the harbourside which was worth doing.
reviews.title: great staff great location and does what it says on the tin!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We used the NCP car park which is fairly expensive even with the discount but there didn't seem to be many other alternatives in the area so we were satisfied enough. Overall I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Premier inn Bristol city centre

reviews.text: We had a lovely one night stay in Bristol, we arrived very late midweek and there was music going on from a local club around the corner, once inside you couldn't hear a thing it was lovely and quiet. The staff were very, very friendly & helpful. We had a peaceful nights sleep and the room was very clean & tidy. It is a great location if you need to attend Bristol Royal Infirmary Hospital several minutes away by car. The breakfast was ok, and as they serve breakfast upstairs and i couldn't get upstairs as i'm on crutches we ordered everything and staff brought it to us in the downstairs part of the restaurant, very quiet. very good over night stop in Bristol
reviews.title: Lovely one night stay last year

reviews.text: Highly recommend this hotel. Not cheap (+£20 per day car parking nearby) but location is superb. Can walk to anywhere and is near waterways. My daughter and I went to a great concert and there is loads to do - as well as shopping of course! Had a slight problem with noise from room above (noisy air-conditioning) but were moved no fuss to another quiet room and ended up having a good night's sleep.
reviews.title: Brilliant location - lovely stay

reviews.text: We had a night stop here for a function in town. We arrived by bus so can't comment on the parking etc. the room was not available so they changed it straight away to one which was. Everything was clean and tidy and we had a very restful sleep.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked online in advance. An amazing location, within walking distance of everything.
reviews.title: Brilliant location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking is a bit pricey, but if you get a cheap room it averages out to still being ok.
reviews.title: noise from road

reviews.text: The Staff and the quality of the room décor is well above average for a Premier Inn. The reception and restaurant staff were very friendly and super efficient. The down side is that outside facing rooms are very, very noisy from the taxi's on cobbles all night, drunken party goers etc until the early hours. I was informed in the morning that there are inner rooms that do not suffer this frustration !!
reviews.title: Great Staff - Noisy Room

reviews.text: I love the fact that you know what to expect whenever you stay at a Premier Inn. Good size room, comfy bed and choice of pillows, everything always spotlessly clean, great breakfast options and friendly staff. This Premier Inn was no exception. Just like the Lenny Henry advert!
reviews.title: Always comfortable and great value

reviews.text: Excellent Friendly Hotel with great acces to City Centre and Train Station. Quality food and service. Beds were really comfortable slept like logs. IF EVER NEEDED TO VISIT BRISTOL AGAIN WOULD DEFINITELY STAY HERE AGAIN.
reviews.title: EXCELLENT VALUE FOR MONEY!

reviews.text: Stayed at Premier Inn for 10 nights over a 3 week period and found the rooms comfortable although some were quite dark and TV had no BBC Channels and there was no decaffeinated tea or coffee available.
reviews.title: Comfortable but facilities not up to scratch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here for one night this weekend for a gig at The Thekla, which is just a three minute walk away from the hotel.
reviews.title: Good standard Premier Inn in a great location

aka: Premier Inn Bristol City Centre King St Hotel Bristol
description: A Premier Inn hotel with air-conditioned rooms and a superb central Bristol location. Next to modern bars and historical pubs, you can walk to theatres, city-centre shops and the harbourside.Beside the river on King Street, this Premier Inn Bristol City Centre hotel is only a few minutes' walk from the Colston Hall, Hippodrome Theatre, Arnolfini Art Centre and the At Bristol complex.Cabot Circus and Broadmead shopping areas are also within walking distance.The full all-you-can-eat breakfast has the expected cooked items, including vegetarian sausages, as well as a wide continental selection.Due to our central location there may be noise.
